note.text: Western clothing is becoming increasingly common in cities, but many Pakistanis continue to wear traditional clothes. The best known of these are "shalwar kameez," or loose trousers and a knee-length shirt. Men may cover these with a coat, and women with a long shawl or wrap. In general, women's clothes are more colorful than men's.
The degree to which women cover their faces and bodies varies by community. The headscarf is relatively new to Pakistan and has begun to replace full veils and robes.
